subject: JUnit Report Generation & Passing input data through XML
msgSnippet: Shyam Kumar S asked hello groupmembers, 1.how should i change the format of the report that the Junit generates. Ant Source is the open source. So whatever you
messageBody:
Shyam Kumar S asked

hello groupmembers,
1.how should i change the format of the report
that the Junit generates.





Ant Source is the open source. So whatever you want you can update it. I
have updated only JUnit Report related files.
I am maintaining all input data in XML file. Using dom4j, i parse all the
input data in JUnit TestCase. You don't hot code the input Data in your
TestCase. If you have five set of input data in XML, your junit script
should take all the input data and produce out put of all the failure data.
Here i have mentined only how to pass set of input data through xml. JUnit
Report modification not yet completed. Latter i will tell the modification
details. This example is very simple one for your understanding.


public void testAddition() {
List listErrors = new ArrayList();
List listPass = new ArrayList();
try {
/* Xml input file name */
Document document = (Document) objSaxReader

.read("D:/dev/Scandent/ScandentTest/TestData/com/workout/testinput/" +
"input.xml");

/* getNodeAsList is a method, this method give list of xml
node values */
/* list1 ---> it contains list of input data. ex 5, 10, 15
*/

List list1 = getNodeAsList(

"/junit/class[@name=\"CalculationTest\"]/method" +
"[@name=\"testAddition\"]/"+ "param1",
document);
/* list2 ---> it contains list of input data. ex 15, 100,
115 */

List list2 = getNodeAsList(

"/junit/class[@name=\"CalculationTest\"]/method" +
"[@name=\"testAddition\"]/"+ "param2",
document);



for (int i = 0; i < list1.size(); i++) {


try{
result = cal

.Addition(Integer.parseInt(list1.get(i).toString()),

Integer.parseInt(list2.get(i).toString()));
assertEquals("Operation Failed",20,result);

} catch (Throwable objExp) {


listErrors.add("InputDataId:<"+i+">"+"expected:<"+
20+">"+"actual:<"+result+">");

}

}

if( listErrors.size() != 0)
{
Iterator itr = null;
StringBuffer sbErrors = new StringBuffer(100);
for(itr=listErrors.iterator();itr.hasNext();)
{
sbErrors.append(itr.next().toString());
sbErrors.append("#");
}
throw new AssertionFailedError(sbErrors.toString()); -- ->
it throws what are the input iteration is faild.
}

} catch (Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
}
*********************************************************************************************************


import org.dom4j.Attribute;
import org.dom4j.Document;
import org.dom4j.Element;
import org.dom4j.Namespace;
import org.dom4j.io.SAXReader;
import org.dom4j.tree.AbstractElement;


- - - - - - - - -- - - - -
- - -- - - - - - - - - - -


/**
* Returns a <i>list </i> of node values for a given XSLT Path. The
Path can
* refer either to an Element or an Attribute
*
* @param strPath -
* An XSLT Path to retrieve a node value
* @param objDocument -
* A document object representing a XML File
* @return A list of node values specified by the path <code>
* strPath </code>
*/
public static List getNodeAsList(String strPath, Document objDocument)
{

List listNodeValues = null;
List listNodeValuesAsString = new ArrayList();
listNodeValues = objDocument.selectNodes(strPath);
Iterator itrNodeTypes = listNodeValues.iterator();

try {
while (itrNodeTypes.hasNext()) {

listNodeValuesAsString.add(getNodeValue(itrNodeTypes.next()));
}
} finally {
listNodeValues = null;
itrNodeTypes = null;
}
return listNodeValuesAsString;
}


**********************************************

input.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<junit>
<class name="CalculationTest">
<method name="testAddition">
<param1>5</param1>
<param2>70</param2>
<param1>5</param1>
<param2>50</param2>
<param1>5</param1>
<param2>70</param2>
<param1>5</param1>
<param2>50</param2>

</method>
</class>
</junit>
